modelIdentification.name: NETN AIS
modelIdentification.purpose: The purpose of the AIS FOM module is to enable the exchange of AIS messages in both a real-time and non real-time platform level simulation, and to support the translation of AIS messages to/from the NMEA 0183 protocol using for example generic gateway components. The AIS FOM module defines almost all of the AIS message types, whose content can be interpreted by applications without knowledge of the NMEA 0183 protocol.
modelIdentification.description:
NATO Education and Training Network (NETN) Automatic Identification System (AIS) Module.
The Automatic Identification System (AIS) is a world-wide automated tracking system used on vessels and by Vessel Traffic Services (VTS) for identifying and locating vessels by electronically exchanging messages with other nearby vessels and VTS stations. 27 message types are defined in ITU-R M.1371-5 annex 8 (see https://www.itu.int). Most commonly used message types are the Position Report Class A (Message types 1,2, and 3) and the Static and Voyage Related Data (Message type 5). And a commonly used live protocol to exhange AIS messages is NMEA-0183. This is an electrical and data specification for communication between marine electronics (see https://www.nmea.org).
The AIS FOM module defines all of the messages types specified in ITU-R M.1371-5 annex 8, with the exception of rarely used message types or message types that are more related to traffic analysis in an AIS network (i.e. 15, 16, 20, 22, 23, 25 and 26). The FOM class structure is closely aligned with the message type specification in ITU-R M.1371-5 annex 8, enabling easy translation to/from NMEA 0183. The message types are modelled as interaction classes and most of the class parameters are optional. The root class - AisMessage - is integrated in the RPR-FOM by subclassing RadioSignal, using the concept of HostRadioIndex to refer to the RadioTransmitter object instance on board of the vessel. The AIS message types include SOTDMA and ITDMA communication state data, but the parameters related to communication state can be omitted if there is no need to model communication.
The AIS FOM module content is based on available open source material from the United States Coast Guard (https://www.navcen.uscg.gov), the GPSD project website (https://gpsd.gitlab.io/gpsd/AIVDM.html), and ITU-R M.1371-5.
modelIdentification.useLimitation: The AIS FOM module is simulation oriented and does not focus on the communication of live AIS data. However, the FOM is aligned well with the specification in ITU-R M.1371-5, enabling relatively easy mapping to/from NMEA 0183.

interactionClass.name: AisRadioSignal
interactionClass.semantics: This is the root interaction class for all AIS messages. The interaction class contains a reference to the embedded system that represents the AIS transmitter. The embedded system should be modelled as a RadioTransmitter, an RPR-FOM object class that is suclassed from Embedded System.

parameter.name: HostRadioIndex
parameter.semantics: Object instance ID of the embedded system host.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage
interactionClass.semantics: Super class for all AIS message types.

parameter.name: messageId
parameter.semantics: Message identifier.

parameter.name: repeatIndicator
parameter.semantics:
Message repeat Indicator.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0.

parameter.name: mmsi
parameter.semantics: The AIS message is from the vessel identified by this MMSI.

interactionClass.name: AisNavigationData
interactionClass.semantics: Message Types 1, 2 and 3 share a common reporting structure for navigational data, captured in this class.

parameter.name: navigationalStatus
parameter.semantics:
Navigational status.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 15 (not defined).

parameter.name: rateOfTurn
parameter.semantics:
Rate of turn.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 128 (not available).

parameter.name: speedOverGround
parameter.semantics:
Speed over ground.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 1023 (not available).

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics:
Position accuracy.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (unaugmented GNSS).

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics:
AIS (Lat,Lon) position.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: Lat=91, Lon=181 (not available, not available).

parameter.name: courseOverGround
parameter.semantics:
Course over ground.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 3600 (not available).

parameter.name: trueHeading
parameter.semantics:
True heading.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 511 (not available).

parameter.name: utcSecond
parameter.semantics:
Second of UTC timestamp.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 60 (not available).

parameter.name: specialManeuverIndicator
parameter.semantics:
Maneuver indication.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics:
RAIM flag.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT 0 (not in use).

interactionClass.name: AisMessage1
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 1: Position Report Class A.
Message type for a scheduled position report; Class A shipborne mobile equipment.
This message transmits information pertaining to a ships navigation: Longitude and latitude, time, heading, speed, ships navigation status (under power, at anchor...). This message is transmitted every 2 to 10 seconds while underway, and every 3 minutes while at anchor.

parameter.name: communicationState
parameter.semantics:
SOTDMA communication state.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: zero filled record.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage2
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 2: Position Report Class A.
Message type for an assigned scheduled position report; Class A shipborne mobile equipment.
This message transmits information pertaining to a ships navigation: Longitude and latitude, time, heading, speed, ships navigation status (under power, at anchor...). This message is transmitted every 2 to 10 seconds while underway, and every 3 minutes while at anchor.

parameter.name: communicationState
parameter.semantics:
SOTDMA state.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: zero filled record.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage3
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 3: Position Report Class A.
Message type for a special position report, response to interrogation; Class A shipborne mobile equipment.
This message transmits information pertaining to a ships navigation: Longitude and latitude, time, heading, speed, ships navigation status (under power, at anchor...). This message is transmitted every 2 to 10 seconds while underway, and every 3 minutes while at anchor.

parameter.name: communicationState
parameter.semantics:
ITDMA state.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: zero filled record.

interactionClass.name: AisBaseStationReportAndUTCDateResponseData
interactionClass.semantics: Common reporting structure for Message Types 4 and 11 for reporting UTC time and date and, at the same time, position. It is also is used by AIS stations for determining if it is within 120 NM for response to Messages Types 20 and 23.

parameter.name: utcYear
parameter.semantics:
Year.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: utcMonth
parameter.semantics:
Month.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: utcDay
parameter.semantics:
Day.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: utcHour
parameter.semantics:
Hour.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 24 (not available).

parameter.name: utcMinute
parameter.semantics:
Minute.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 60 (not available).

parameter.name: utcSecond
parameter.semantics:
Second.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 60 (not available).

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics:
Position accuracy.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (unaugmented GNSS).

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics:
AIS (Lat,Lon) position.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: Lat=91, Lon=181 (not available, not available).

parameter.name: posType
parameter.semantics:
Type of electronic position fixing device.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (undefined).

parameter.name: transmissionControl
parameter.semantics:
Transmission control for long-range broadcast message.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT 0.

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics:
RAIM.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT 0 (not in use).

interactionClass.name: AisMessage4
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 4: Base Station Report.
This message is to be used by fixed-location base stations to periodically report a position and time reference.

parameter.name: communicationState
parameter.semantics:
SOTDMA state.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: zero filled record.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage11
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 11: UTC/Date Response.
Identical to Message Type 4, with the semantics of a response to inquiry. Message Type 11 is only transmitted from a mobile station as a result of a UTC request message (Message Type 10).

parameter.name: communicationState
parameter.semantics:
SOTDMA state.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: zero filled record.

interactionClass.name: AisStaticandVoyageData
interactionClass.semantics: Common Static and Voyage Data for Message Types 5, 19 and 24.

parameter.name: callsign
parameter.semantics: 7 six-bit characters for the callsign.

parameter.name: name
parameter.semantics: 20 six-bit characters for the name.

parameter.name: shipType
parameter.semantics:
Ship type.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available or no ship).

parameter.name: dimBow
parameter.semantics:
GPS Ant. Distance from bow.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: dimStern
parameter.semantics:
GPS Ant. Distance from stern.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: dimPort
parameter.semantics:
GPS Ant. Distance from port.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: dimStarboard
parameter.semantics:
GPS Ant. Distance from starboard.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

interactionClass.name: AisMessage5
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 5: Static and Voyage Related Data.
This message type is transmitted every 6 minutes and should only be used by Class A shipborne and SAR aircraft AIS stations when reporting static or voyage related data.

parameter.name: version
parameter.semantics:
2 bit value for AIS version.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (UT1371).

parameter.name: imo
parameter.semantics:
30 bit value for IMO ship ID number. Not applicable to SAR aircraft.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: positionFixType
parameter.semantics:
4 bit value for type of electronic position fixing device.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (undefined).

parameter.name: etaMonth
parameter.semantics:
Month.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: etaDay
parameter.semantics:
Day.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: etaHour
parameter.semantics:
Hour.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 24 (not available).

parameter.name: etaMinute
parameter.semantics:
Month.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 60 (not available).

parameter.name: draught
parameter.semantics:
Maximum present static draught.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: dest
parameter.semantics:
20 six-bit characters for the destination.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ (not available).
For SAR aircraft, the use of this field may be decided by the responsible administration.

parameter.name: dte
parameter.semantics:
Data terminal equipment (DTE).
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 1 (not available).

interactionClass.name: AisMessage19
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 19: Extended Class B CS Position Report.
A slightly more detailed report than Message Type 18 for vessels using Class B transmitters. Omits navigational status and rate of turn. Fields are as in the common navigation block and the Message Type 5 message.

parameter.name: speedOverGround
parameter.semantics:
Speed over ground.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 1023 (not available).

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics:
Position accuracy.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (unaugmented GNSS).

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics:
AIS (Lat,Lon) position.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: Lat=91, Lon=181 (not available, not available).

parameter.name: courseOverGround
parameter.semantics:
Course over ground.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 3600 (not available).

parameter.name: trueHeading
parameter.semantics:
True heading.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 511 (not available).

parameter.name: utcSecond
parameter.semantics:
Second of UTC timestamp.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 60 (not available).

parameter.name: posType
parameter.semantics:
4 bit value for type of electronic position fixing device.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (undefined).

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics:
RAIM.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT 0 (not in use).

parameter.name: dte
parameter.semantics:
Data terminal equipment (DTE).
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 1 (not available).

parameter.name: mode
parameter.semantics:
Mode.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (autonomous and continuous mode).

interactionClass.name: AisMessage24
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 24: Static Data Report.
Equivalent of Message Type 5 for ships using Class B equipment. Also used to associate an MMSI with a name on either class A or class B equipment. A Message Type 24 may be in part A or part B format. According to the standard, parts A and B are expected to be broadcast in adjacent pairs.

parameter.name: partNumber
parameter.semantics: Part number.

parameter.name: vendorId
parameter.semantics: (Part B) 3 six-bit chars.

parameter.name: unitModelCode
parameter.semantics: (Part B) Unit Model Code.

parameter.name: serialNumber
parameter.semantics: Serial Number.

interactionClass.name: AisBinaryMessageData
interactionClass.semantics: Binary Payload for Message Types 6 and 8. The interpretation of the binary payload is controlled by: - The Designated Area Code (DAC), which is a jurisdiction code: 366 for the United States. It uses the same encoding as the area designator in MMMSIs; see [ITU-MID]. 1 designates international (ITU) messages. - The FID, which is the Functional ID for a message subtype. In some sources this is abbreviated FI.

parameter.name: dac
parameter.semantics: Designated area code (DAC).

parameter.name: fi
parameter.semantics: Functional ID (FID).

parameter.name: data
parameter.semantics: Binary data up to 920 bits.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage6
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 6: Binary Addressed Message.
Message type 6 is an addressed point-to-point message with unspecified binary payload.

parameter.name: seqNum
parameter.semantics: Sequence Number.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.semantics: Destination MMSI.

parameter.name: retransmit
parameter.semantics: Retransmit flag.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage8
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 8: Binary Broadcast Message.
Message Type 8 is a broadcast message with a binary payload.

interactionClass.name: AcknowledgeData
interactionClass.semantics: Acknowledge data for Message Types 7 and 13.

parameter.name: dest1
parameter.semantics: MMSI number 1.

parameter.name: seq1
parameter.semantics: Sequence for MMSI 1.

parameter.name: dest2
parameter.semantics: MMSI number 2.

parameter.name: seq2
parameter.semantics: Sequence for MMSI 2.

parameter.name: dest3
parameter.semantics: MMSI number 3.

parameter.name: seq3
parameter.semantics: Sequence for MMSI 3.

parameter.name: dest4
parameter.semantics: MMSI number 4.

parameter.name: seq4
parameter.semantics: Sequence for MMSI 4.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage7
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 7: Binary Acknowledge.
Message type 7 is a receipt acknowledgement to the senders of a previous messages of Message Type 6. Total length varies depending on the number of destination MMSIs included (1..4).

interactionClass.name: AisMessage13
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 13: Safety-Related Acknowledgement.
Message Type 13 is a receipt acknowledgement to senders of previous messages of Message Type 12.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage9
interactionClass.semantics:
Message type 9: Standard SAR Aircraft Position Report.
Tracking information for search-and-rescue aircraft.

parameter.name: altitude
parameter.semantics:
Altitude.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 4095 (not available).

parameter.name: speedOverGround
parameter.semantics:
Speed over ground.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 1023 (not available).

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics:
Position accuracy.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (unaugmented GNSS).

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics:
Position.
AIS (Lat,Lon) position.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: Lat=91, Lon=181 (not available, not available).

parameter.name: courseOverGround
parameter.semantics:
Course over ground.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 3600 (not available).

parameter.name: utcSec
parameter.semantics:
Second of UTC timestamp.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 60 (not available).

parameter.name: regionalReserved
parameter.semantics:
Reserved.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: zero value.

parameter.name: dte
parameter.semantics:
Data terminal equipment (DTE).
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 1 (not available).

parameter.name: mode
parameter.semantics:
Mode flag.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (autonomous and continuous mode).

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics:
RAIM flag.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT 0 (not in use).

parameter.name: commsState
parameter.semantics:
Communication state.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: zero values.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage10
interactionClass.semantics: Type 10: UTC/Date Inquiry. Request for UTC/Date information from an AIS base station.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.semantics: Destination MMSI.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage12
interactionClass.semantics:
Type 12: Addressed Safety-Related Message.
This is a point-to-point text message. The payload is interpreted as six-bit text.

parameter.name: seqNum
parameter.semantics: Sequence Number.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.semantics: Destination MMSI.

parameter.name: retransmitFlag
parameter.semantics:
Retransmit flag.
0 (false) = no retransmit (default), 1 (true) = retransmitted

parameter.name: message
parameter.semantics: 1-156 chars of six-bit text.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage14
interactionClass.semantics:
Type 14: Safety-Related Broadcast Message.
This is a broadcast text message. The payload is interpreted as six-bit text.

parameter.name: message
parameter.semantics: 1-161 chars of six-bit text.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage17
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 17: DGNSS Broadcast Binary Message. Message Type 17 is used to broadcast differential corrections for GPS. The data in the payload is intended to be passed directly to GPS receivers capable of accepting such corrections.
Note that latitude and longitude are in units of a tenth of a minute; sign interpretation and out-of-band values are as in the Common Navigation Clock. (Note, however, that the hex representation of the out-of-band values differs; it is 181 \* 60 \* 10 = 0x1a838 for longitude, 91 \* 60 \* 10 = 0xd548 for latitude.)

parameter.name: lon
parameter.semantics: Signed: minutes/10.

parameter.name: lat
parameter.semantics: Signed: minutes/10.

parameter.name: data
parameter.semantics: Differential correction data. If interrogated and differential correction service not available, the data field should remain empty (zero bits). This should be interpreted by the recipient as DGNSS data words set to zero.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage18
interactionClass.semantics: Message Type 18: Standard Class B CS Position Report. A less detailed report than message types 1-3 for vessels using Class B transmitters. Omits navigational status and rate of turn.

parameter.name: speedOverGround
parameter.semantics:
Speed over ground.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 1023 (not available).

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics:
Position accuracy.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (unaugmented GNSS).

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics:
AIS (Lat,Lon) position.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: Lat=91, Lon=181 (not available, not available).

parameter.name: courseOverGround
parameter.semantics:
Course over ground.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 3600 (not available).

parameter.name: trueHeading
parameter.semantics:
True heading.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 511 (not available).

parameter.name: utcSec
parameter.semantics:
Second of UTC timestamp.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 60 (not available).

parameter.name: classBUnitFlag
parameter.semantics:
0 (false) = Class B SOTDMA unit. 1 (true) = Class B CS (Carrier Sense) unit.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: false.

parameter.name: classBDisplayFlag
parameter.semantics:
0 (false) = No visual display. 1 (true) = Has display.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: false.

parameter.name: classBDscFlag
parameter.semantics:
True if unit is attached to a VHF voice radio with DSC capability, false otherwise.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: false.

parameter.name: classBBandFlag
parameter.semantics:
Base stations can command units to switch frequency. If this flag is true, then the unit can use any part of the marine channel.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: false.

parameter.name: classBMsg22Flag
parameter.semantics:
True if unit can accept a channel assignment via Message Type 22, false otherwise.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: false.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.semantics:
Mode.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (autonomous and continuous mode).

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics:
RAIM.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT 0 (not in use).

parameter.name: commsState
parameter.semantics:
Communication state.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: zero values.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage21
interactionClass.semantics: Message Type 21: Aid-to-Navigation Report. Identification and location message to be emitted by aids to navigation such as buoys and lighthouses.

parameter.name: aidType
parameter.semantics: Type of aid.

parameter.name: name
parameter.semantics: Name in 20 sixbit chars. If this field is full (has no trailing @ characters) the chars in the Name Extension field later in the message must be concatenate it to this name to obtain the full name.

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics:
Position accuracy.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (unaugmented GNSS).

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics:
AIS (Lat,Lon) position.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: Lat=91, Lon=181 (not available, not available).

parameter.name: dimBow
parameter.semantics:
Dimension to bow in [m].
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: dimStern
parameter.semantics:
Distance to sterm [m].
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: dimPort
parameter.semantics:
Distance to port [m].
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: dimStarboard
parameter.semantics:
Distance to starboard [m].
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (not available).

parameter.name: positionType
parameter.semantics:
Type of EPFD.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (undefined).

parameter.name: utcSecond
parameter.semantics:
Second of UTC timestamp.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 60 (not available).

parameter.name: offPositionFlag
parameter.semantics:
Off-Position Indicator. The Off-Position Indicator is for floating Aids-to-Navigation only: 0 (false) means on position; 1 (true) means off position. Only valid if UTC second is equal to or below 59.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: false.

parameter.name: regional
parameter.semantics:
Regional reserved.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: zero value.

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics:
RAIM.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT 0 (not in use).

parameter.name: virtualFlag
parameter.semantics:
Virtual-aid flag. The Virtual Aid flag is interpreted as follows: 0 (false) = default = real Aid to Navigation at indicated position; 1 (true) = virtual Aid to Navigation simulated by nearby AIS station.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: false.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.semantics:
Mode.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (autonomous and continuous mode).

parameter.name: nameExt
parameter.semantics: If present, the Name Extension consists of max 14 six-bit chars that must be concatenated to the name parameter. This parameter must be omitted when no more than 20 characters for the name are needed in total. Only the required number of characters should be listed, i.e. no @-character should be used in the name extension.

interactionClass.name: AisMessage27
interactionClass.semantics:
Message Type 27: Long Range AIS Broadcast message.
This message is primarily intended for long-range detection of AIS Class A equipped vessels (typically by satellite). This message has a similar content to Messages 1, 2 and 3, but the total number of bits has been compressed to allow for increased propagation delays associated with long-range detection.

parameter.name: positionAccuracy
parameter.semantics:
Position accuracy.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 0 (unaugmented GNSS).

parameter.name: raim
parameter.semantics:
RAIM.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT 0 (not in use).

parameter.name: navigationStatus
parameter.semantics:
Navigational status.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 15 (not defined).

parameter.name: position
parameter.semantics:
AIS (Lat,Lon) position.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: Lat=91, Lon=181 (not available, not available).

parameter.name: speedOverGround
parameter.semantics:
Speed over ground.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 63 (not available).

parameter.name: courseOverGround
parameter.semantics:
Course over ground.
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: 511 (not available).

parameter.name: gnssPositionStatusFlag
parameter.semantics:
GNSS Position status. 0 (false) = current GNSS position. 1 (true) = not GNSS position (default).
OPTIONAL. DEFAULT: true.

simpleData.name: MMSIBit30
simpleData.semantics: The MMSI number (Maritime Mobile Service Identity) is a unique nine-digit number for identifying a vessel. An MMSI number has the format MIDXXXXXX. The first three digits are called MID (Maritime Identification Digits) and represent the nationality. The last six digits are used for the unique identification of the vessel.

simpleData.name: RateOfTurnBit8
simpleData.semantics:
The turn rate is encoded as follows: 0 = not turning 1…126 = turning right at up to 708 degrees per minute or higher 1…-126 = turning left at up to 708 degrees per minute or higher 127 = turning right at more than 5deg/30s (No TI available) -127 = turning left at more than 5deg/30s (No TI available) 128 (80 hex) indicates no turn information available (default)
Values between 0 and 708 degrees/min coded by ROTAIS=4.733 * SQRT(ROTsensor) degrees/min where ROTsensor is the Rate of Turn as input by an external Rate of Turn Indicator. ROTAIS is rounded to the nearest integer value. Thus, to decode the field value, divide by 4.733 and then square it. Sign of the field value should be preserved when squaring it, otherwise the left/right indication will be lost.

simpleData.name: SpeedOverGroundBit10
simpleData.semantics: Speed over ground is in deci-knot resolution from 0 to 102 knots. Value 1023 indicates speed is not available, value 1022 indicates 102.2 knots or higher.

simpleData.name: CourseOverGroundBit12
simpleData.semantics: Course over ground. Course is relative to the true north, to 0.1 degree precision. Course over ground will be 3600 (0xE10) if that data is not available.

simpleData.name: TrueHeadingBit9
simpleData.semantics: The true heading is from 0 to 359 degrees, 511 = not available.

simpleData.name: UTCsecondBit6
simpleData.semantics: UTC second when the report was generated by the electronic position system (EPFS) (0-59, or 60 if time stamp is not available, which is the default value, or 61 if positioning system is in manual input mode, or 62 if electronic position fixing system operates in estimated (dead reckoning) mode, or 63 if the positioning system is inoperative).

simpleData.name: SlotTimeOutBit3
simpleData.semantics: SlotTimeOut specifies the number of frames remaining until a new slot is selected: 0 means that this was the last transmission in this slot. 1-7 means that 1 to 7 frames respectively are left until slot change.

simpleData.name: SubMessageBit14
simpleData.semantics: The sub message depends on the current value in slot time-out as described in Table 19 of [ITU-R M.1371-5].

simpleData.name: SlotIncrementBit13
simpleData.semantics: ITDMA Slot Increment.

simpleData.name: NumberOfSlotsBit3
simpleData.semantics: ITDMA Number of Slots.

simpleData.name: UTCyearBit14
simpleData.semantics: Year in the range 1-9999, 0 = N/A (default).

simpleData.name: UTCmonthBit4
simpleData.semantics: Month in the range 1-12; 0 = N/A (default).

simpleData.name: UTCdayBit5
simpleData.semantics: Day in the range 1-31; 0 = N/A (default).

simpleData.name: UTChourBit5
simpleData.semantics: Hour in the range 0-23; 24 = N/A (default).

simpleData.name: UTCminuteBit6
simpleData.semantics: Minute in the range 0-59; 60 = N/A (default).

simpleData.name: ShipTypeBit8
simpleData.semantics: Type of ship and cargo type: 0 = not available or no ship = default. Not applicable to SAR aircraft.

simpleData.name: BowDimensionBit9
simpleData.semantics: Distance from bow: Reference point for reported position. Also indicates the dimension of ship (m). When GPS position is not available, but the ships dimension is available, then this field should be 0. The value 511 indicates 511 meters or greater.

simpleData.name: SternDimensionBit9
simpleData.semantics: GPS Ant. Distance from stern Reference point for reported position. Also indicates the dimension of ship (m). NOTE: When GPS position is not available, but the ships dimensions is available, then this field should be representing the length of the ship. The value 511 indicates 511 meters or greater.

simpleData.name: PortDimensionBit6
simpleData.semantics: GPS Ant. Distance from port Reference point for reported position. Also indicates the dimension of ship (m). NOTE: When GPS position is not available, but the ships dimensions is available, then this field should be 0. The value 63 indicates 63 meters or greater.

simpleData.name: StarboardDimensionBit6
simpleData.semantics: GPS Ant. Distance from starboard: Reference point for reported position. Also indicates the dimension of ship (m). NOTE: When GPS position is not available, but the ships dimensions is available, then this field should be representing the with of the ship. The value 63 indicates 63 meters or greater.

simpleData.name: IMOBit30
simpleData.semantics: IMO ship ID number. Not applicable to SAR aircraft.

simpleData.name: DraughtBit8
simpleData.semantics: The maximum present static draught in deci-meters: 255 = draught 25.5 m or greater 0 = not available = default Not applicable to SAR aircraft, should be set to 0.

simpleData.name: PartNumberBit2
simpleData.semantics: Part number: Bit 0 - Part A. Bit 1 - Part B.

simpleData.name: UnitModelCodeBit4
simpleData.semantics: (Part B) Unit Model Code.

simpleData.name: SerialNumberBit20
simpleData.semantics: (Part B) Serial Number.

simpleData.name: SequenceNumberBit2
simpleData.semantics: Sequence Number.

simpleData.name: DesignatedAreaCodeBit10
simpleData.semantics: Designated area code (DAC).

simpleData.name: FunctionIDBit6
simpleData.semantics: Functional ID (FID).

simpleData.name: AltitudeBit12
simpleData.semantics: Altitude of SAR aircraft. The special value 4095 indicates altitude is not available; 4094 indicates 4094 meters or higher.

simpleData.name: SpeedOverGroundInKnotsBit10
simpleData.semantics: Speed over ground is in knots, not deci-knots as in the AisNavigationData class; aircraft go faster. The special value 1023 indicates speed not available, 1022 indicates 1022 knots or higher.

simpleData.name: RegionalReservedBit8
simpleData.semantics: Regional reserved value.

simpleData.name: DeciLongitudeBit18
simpleData.semantics: Longitude as signed value in deci-minutes.

simpleData.name: DeciLatitudeBit17
simpleData.semantics: Latitude as signed value in deci-minutes.

simpleData.name: SpeedOverGroundInKnotsBit6
simpleData.semantics: Speed over ground in knots. Knots (0-62); 63 = N/A (default).

simpleData.name: CourseOverGroundBit9
simpleData.semantics: Course over Ground. 0 to 359 degrees, 511 = not available.

simpleData.name: LatitudeBit27
simpleData.semantics: Latitude is given in in 1/10000 min; divide by 600000.0 to obtain degrees. Values up to plus or minus 90 degrees, North = positive, South = negative. A value of 91 degrees (0x3412140 hex) indicates latitude is not available and is the default.

simpleData.name: LongitudeBit28
simpleData.semantics: Longitude is given in in 1/10000 min; divide by 600000.0 to obtain degrees. Values up to plus or minus 180 degrees, East = positive, West \= negative. A value of 181 degrees (0x6791AC0 hex) indicates that longitude is not available and is the default.

simpleData.name: IntegerType
simpleData.semantics: 16 bit integer value.

simpleData.name: RepeatIndicatorBit2
simpleData.semantics: Message repeat Indicator. The Repeat Indicator is a directive to an AIS transceiver that this message should be rebroadcast. This was intended as a way of getting AIS messages around hills and other obstructions in coastal waters, but is little used as base station coverage is more effective. It is intended that the bit be incremented on each retransmission, to a maximum of three hops. A value of 3 indicates "Do not repeat".

simpleData.name: Bit03
simpleData.semantics: 3 bit unsigned integer.

simpleData.name: Bit05
simpleData.semantics: 5 bit unsigned integer.

simpleData.name: Bit13
simpleData.semantics: 13 bit unsigned integer.

simpleData.name: Bit10
simpleData.semantics: 10 bit unsigned integer.

simpleData.name: Bit06
simpleData.semantics: 6 bit unsigned integer.

enumeratedData.name: MsgIdEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for the message type.

enumeratedData.name: NavigationStatusEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value to indicate the navigational status.

enumeratedData.name: ManeuverIndicatorEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value to indicate a maneuver.

enumeratedData.name: RAIMEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for the receiver autonomous integrity monitoring (RAIM) flag of the electronic position fixing device; 0 = RAIM not in use = default; 1 = RAIM in use.

enumeratedData.name: PositionAccuracyEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value to indicate the position accuracy. The position accuracy indicates the accuracy of the fix. A value of 1 indicates a DGPS-quality fix with an accuracy of < 10ms. 0, the default, indicates an unaugmented GNSS fix with accuracy > 10m.

enumeratedData.name: CommunicationSyncStateEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value that defines the sync state of the own station.

enumeratedData.name: PositionFixTypeEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for he EPFD type.

enumeratedData.name: DataTerminlEquipmentEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration for Data terminal equipment (DTE): 0 = available 1 = not available = default

enumeratedData.name: AssignedModeEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for the assigned mode: 0 = Station operating in autonomous and continuous mode = default 1 = Station operating in assigned mode

enumeratedData.name: TransmissionControlEnum
enumeratedData.semantics:
Enumeration value for the transmission control for long-range broadcast message.
0 = default – Class-A AIS station stops transmission of Message 27 within an AIS base station coverage area. 1 = Request Class-A station to transmit Message 27 within an AIS base station coverage area. Base station coverage area should be defined by Message 23; If Message 23 is not received, the AIS station which is allowed to transmit on CH75 and 76 should ignore this bit and transmit Message 27.

enumeratedData.name: CommunicationStateSelectorEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for the communication state.

enumeratedData.name: AidTypeEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Enumeration value for the aid type. According to [IALA], the aid type field has values 1-15 for fixed and 16-31 for floating aids to navigation.

fixedRecordData.name: SOTDMACommunicationState

field.name: slotTimeOut
field.semantics: The number of frames remaining until a new slot is selected.

fixedRecordData.name: ITDMACommunicationState
DifferentialCorrectionData
fixedRecordData.semantics: Differential correction data. If interrogated and differential correction service not available, the data field should remain empty (zero bits). This should be interpreted by the recipient as DGNSS data words set to zero.

field.name: n
field.semantics: Number of DGNSS data words following the two word header, up to a maximum of 29.

field.name: health
field.semantics: Reference station health (specified in Recommendation ITU-R M.823).

field.name: dataWords
field.semantics: DGNSS message data words excluding parity.
